BaseMods.MiscDesc: Add [SETBACK][SETBACK] to Perception and Computers checks to find this weapon on a body. May not be reloaded.

Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Name: Disruptor Pistol
Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

BaseMods.MiscDesc: Time taken to access this weapon cannot be reduced by talents, gear, or other means.
[THREAT][THREAT] may cause weapon to run out of ammo.
May ignore first [DESPAIR] "out of ammo"during combat, or may modify with Easy ([DIFFICULTY]) Mechanics check to add +2 damage. Modded weapon may explode with [DESPAIR].
[THREAT][THREAT][THREAT] may cause out of ammo.
Mechanics Checks to repair gain [BOOST].
[THREAT][THREAT] may cause weapon to run out of ammo.
Disorient affects all characters in Short range, even if not damaged.
Disorient affects all characters in Short range, even if not damaged. Concussive affects all Engaged characters, even if not damaged.
Every successful hit inflicts 1 strain on wielder.
Add [SETBACK] to attempts to locate a concealed vibroknuckler.
Damage uses Planetary scale, Blast uses Personal scale. [DESPAIR] means it detonates immediately. +50 to critical if Engaged when detonates.
Variable damage for additional grenades: +20, +30, +40, +50 (150 max). After 5, blast radius increased by one band per grenade.
Each [SUCCESS] on attack check adds 2 damage.
Each [SUCCESS] on attack check adds 2 damage.
Does not break due to [DESPAIR] or [THREAT].
Enemies caught in the tractor beam add [SETBACK][SETBACK] to all Piloting checks and attacks, and suffer 1 system strain when performing Accelerate/Decelerate, Fly/Drive, or Punch It maneuvers.
Add [SETBACK] to Perception checks to find this weapon on a body. May not be reloaded.
Add [SETBACK] to Perception checks to find this weapon on a body. [THREAT][THREAT] or [DESPAIR] damages weapon by one step.
Add [SETBACK] to Perception checks to find a Boonta Blaster on a wearer's body.
Remove [SETBACK] from the wearer's Deception checks to explain away the Boonta Blaster as purely ornamental or otherwise non-threatening.
Target struck by a round from the KD-30 suffers one wound, ignoring soak, at the beginning of his turn for the next two rounds.
Add [SETBACK][SETBACK] to Perception checks to find a Stealth-2VX Palm Shooter on a wearer's body.
Burn quality may be activated multiple times, affecting a different target hit by the attack each time.
GM may spend [THREAT][THREAT] or [DESPAIR] to apply Burn quality to an ally hit by original attack.
May be loaded with 1 dose of neurotoxin, anesthetic, or neuroparalytic, or other suitable toxins.
Unless outdoors in a windy environment, gas lingers for two rounds, affecting anyone in the cloud. In a poorly ventilated space, gas lingers for five rounds.
Droids, or characters equipped with sealed suits, breath masks, respirators, or rebreathers, are unaffected.
Add [SE][SE] to a character's Perception checks to find a stingbeam on a person's body.
Add [SE][SE] to Perception checks to notice pistol stashed aboard a starship.
Reduce the difficulty of Mechanics checks to repair a Model 53 or modify attachments on it by one.
Increase difficulty of Mechanics checks to repair or modify attachments by one.
When attacking, do not increase the difficulty of the check for being engaged.
No effect on targets wearing breath masks or without respiratory systems.
Can be used to fight fires. Add [BO] to attempts to put out a fire. Assisted checks add [BO] per character with a Cryoban Projector.
Do not require a hand to wield. Add [SE] to a Perception checks to notice they are a weapon.
Add [SE][SE] to Perception checks to find on a person's body.
Computers hit by this grenade lose all programming and data.

A droid hit by this grenade must make a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Resilience check or suffer 1 strain plus 1 strain per [FAILURE]. [DESPAIR] or [THREAT][THREAT][THREAT] can cause memory loss, at GM discretion.

A character hit by this grenade must make a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Resilience check or become disoriented for 1 round per [THREAT]. Additionally, he has an inaccurate or incomplete memory of the encounter.
Add [SETBACK][SETBACK][SETBACK] to determine that needle gloves are lethal.
Add [SETBACK][SETBACK] to Perception checks to find a stealth vibroknife on a person's body.
Add [BOOST] when attempting to convince others to allow him to retain his ceremonial blade.
Add [SETBACK] to Perception checks to find this weapon on a body.
Can run out of ammo by spending [THREAT][THREAT][THREAT].
Add [SETBACK][SETBACK] to Perception checks to find this weapon on a body.
Add [SETBACK] to Perception checks to determine that a sword cane is actually a lethal weapon.
Add [BOOST][BOOST] when attempting to convince others to allow him to retain his staff of office.
Anyone searching an individual carrying a concealed variable holdout blaster adds [SETBACK] to their Perception checks.
Wielder must choose a power setting between 1 and 7. This is the amount of damage a successful shot will inflict, and is also the amount of ammo expended.
Ink obscures vision and blocks line of sight for up to 4 rounds.
All combat checks to operate outside of water have their difficulty upgraded twice.
Organics hit with droid disruptor only receive brief shock and suffer 2 strain.

The first time a character hit by this grenade (even if he suffers no damage) must roll a single [CH]. As long as the character doesn't roll a  [DE], he is affected normally. If he rolls a [DE], he immediately suffers 6 strain and begins to suffocate. A Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Medicine check is required to stop the subject from suffocating.

Character may make an Average ([DI][DI]) Ranged (Light) check to secure the grappling hook to an object within medium range. An Average ([DI][DI]) Athletics check may be used to carry another character with him.
The GM may spend [DE] to have the energy buckler run out of power and stop functioning until the end of the encounter.

When hit, may commit [FO] as OOT Incidental. As action, may uncommit all [FO] and make a Force power check with that many [FO], taking 1 Conflict per [FO]. May spend [FP] to inflict 1 wound and 1 strain, ignoring soak, on each character within short range.
A rivet gun reduces the difficulty of Mechanics checks to repair Critical Hits on vehicles and starships by 1 (to a minimum of Simple [-].
Welding rods add automatic [AD] to Mechanics checks to repair droids, vehicles, and starships.
[DE] may be used to inflict a Critical Injury on user.
Hand grinders add automatic [AD] to crafting checks that involve shaping large pieces of hardened material.
Gain automatic [AD] on Mechanics checks to repair droids, vehicles, or starships.
Gain automatic [AD] on Mechanics checks to repair droids, vehicles, or starships.
[TH][TH] or [DE] on a Mechanics or Combat check may be spent to have all of its spray cartridges to run out.
If retrieved, boomerang can be used again.
May spend [AD] on missed attack to have boomerange return to thrower's hand.
An atlatl must have a supply of plasma balls for ammunition.
Triggering the Disorient quality requires [AD] instead of [AD][AD].
Attacks made by this lightsaber ignore the Cortosis quality.
This lightsaber cannot be shut down due to contact with refined Cortosis.
Add [BO][BO] to any check made to sabotage electronics or computers.
Add [SE] to Perception checks made to find this weapon on a person's body.
A character may make an Average([DI][DI]) Mechanics check to add or remove an attachment to a DDC-MR6 as an action.

While attached to a suitable power source (such as a base's power grid or a similarly-sized generator), this wweapon loses the Limited Ammo 8 quality. Wiring the weapon into a power source requires several minutes and an Easy ([DI]) Mechanics check.
User may spend [AD][AD][AD] from any combat check to throw the weapon to cause the shield to ricochet back to their grasp.
Requires two hands to use.

May spend [TH][TH] from any combat check with this weapon to have it produce a loud noise, spooking nearby animals and adding [SE][SE] to user's next Survival check in this area to hunt or track prey.
Grants [BO] to all Survival checks.
Add [SE] to Perception checks to find an SH-9 slugthrower pistol on a person's body.
Add [SE] to Perception or Vigilance checks made to locate a concealed shooter firing an SH-9 slugthrower pistol.

The GM may spend [DE] or [TH][TH] from any combat check made with this weapon to have it overheat; the wielder suffers 2 strain and the weapon becomes damaged one step: from undamaged to Minor, Minor to Moderate, or Moderate to Major.
This weapon can only be used in Auto-fire mode.

The GM may spend [DE] or [TH][TH] from any combat check made with this weapon to have it overheat; the wielder suffers 2 strain and the weapon becomes damaged one step: from undamaged to Minor, Minor to Moderate, or Moderate to Major.
Reduce the difficulty of Mechanics checks to repair a BlasTech A280 heavy blaster rifle by 1 (to a minimum of Simple [-]).
User may spend [AD][AD][AD] from any combat check to throw the weapon to cause the shield to ricochet back to their grasp.

The GM may spend [DE] from a combat check with this weapon to cause it to jam, detonating the contents, inflicting a hit from the loaded grenade on the wielder and each character at engaged range, and damaging the weapon two steps. The GM may spend additional [DE] to trigger one of the loaded grenade's qualities.

As a maneuver, user may prime the weapon to expend all of its ammunition in a single, devastating burst. The next time the weapon is fired this encounter, it counts as having the Blast 7 and Concussive 1 quality. After being discharged this way, the weapon runs out of ammunition.

As a maneuver, a character wielding a pulse cannon may prime the weapon to expend all of its ammunition in a single, devastating shot. The next time the weapon is fired this encounter, it counts as having the Breach 1 and Vicious 3 qualities. After being discharged this way, the weapon runs out of ammunition.
The Combat Utility Vibroblade serves as a tool kit to allow Mechanics checks to repair devices and to "heal"droids, but adds [SE] to such checks.
Adds [BO] to the character's Survival checks.
This weapon can only be used in Auto-fire mode.
The GM may spend [DE] or [TH][TH][TH][TH] from a combat check with this weapon to have the wielder suffer a Critical injury with -50 to the roll, to a minimum of 1.
May spend [DE] or [TH][TH][TH] on enemy Melee or Lightsaber check to disarm enemy.
May spend [AD][AD] or [TR] to prevent opponent from using Parry to reduce damage.
When used with the Saber Throw talent, may spend [AD][AD] or [TR] instead of [FP] to have phase-knife return to the wielder's hand.
Removes all [SE] added by a personal deflector shield.
Adds [SE] to Perception checks to find a concealed needler on an individual.
May be loaded with 1 dose of synthetic neuroparalytic or any other poison. Whenever wielder successfully attacks a target, even if no damage is dealt, the target suffers the effects of the poison.
GM may spend [TH][TH] to damage weapon one step.
GM may spend [DE] to cause weapon to meltdown and expload, destroying weapon and causing base damage to wielder.
May spend [TH][TH][TH] or [DE] from combat checks with this weapon to have it become damaged one step.
When CR-8 is properly broken down and concealed, add [SE][SE] to Perception checks made to find it on a person.
Whenever a living target is hit with a T-7 ion disruptor, any Crititcal Injury results in a "Crippled"effect unless the roll on the Critical Injury table would result in a more grievous injury.
Whenever a vehicle or starship is hit with a T-7 ion distruptor, any Critical Hit results in a "Component Hit"effect, unless the roll on the Critical Hit table would result in a more serious effect.
Reduce the difficulty of combat checks made with this weapon by one against targets at long or extreme range.
Up to three micro-rockets can be loaded into the launcher. Use the fired rocket's profile, but the launcher's range, if longer.
As an action, make an Average ([DI][DI]) Ranged (Light) check to secure hook to an object within medium range.
Once secured, the cord may be reeled in as an action.
To pull another character aloft, must succeed in an Average ([DI][DI]) Athletics check.
When set to stun, range changes to medium.
Character who set mine can spend [TH][TH] from target pilot's Piloting (Space) check to force the pilot to repeat the check at one less difficulty.
Creates a gravitic bubble, preventing all ships within long range from entering hyperspace.
When a vessel is struck by a firecracker mine, each occupant is disoriented for three rounds.
If armor removes one or more [SE] due to extreme cold, Pierce quality counts as 0.
When making a melee attack against a target struck by a Loronar CryoBan in the current round, add [BO][BO] to the check.
Ensnare quality automatically activates if grenade hits, with no need to spend [AD].
Add [SE][SE] to find a fear stick on the owner's body.
On successful hit, attacker may spend [TR] to force a living target to make a Formidable ([DI][DI][DI][DI][DI]) Fear check.
All [SE] added to a combat check due to the target's cover are removed when using this weapon.
GMs may make this weapon run out of ammo by spending [TH][TH][TH], as well as [DE].
When detonates inside a mine field, triggers every mine within medium range.
GM may spend [TH][TH] or [DE] to detonate a fraction of the mines within a mine field.
If Disorient or Knockdown qualities are activated, they affect all characters at short range, even if not damaged.
If using to put out a fire, CryoBan grenade adds [BO] to the attempt.
Concussive rating increases by 1 for each additional charge.
[DE] on check to set up fuel bomb means it detonates immediately.
Breach and Vicious ratings increases by 1 for each additional charge.

When Ensare quantity is activated, target vehicle's pilot must make an Average ([DI][DI]) Piloting check to free vehicle. If target is at least 1 silhouette lower than attacker, [TH][TH] on failed check will draw target 1 range band closer to attacker.
As a maneuver, the user can convert the bo-rifle from its melee mode to ranged mode.
While wielding an Ashla Staff and making a Force power check, a player may spend 3 strain to add [LI] to the results.
When installing a lightsaber crystal into a broadsaber, increase the damage of that lightsaber crystal by 1.
When installing a lightsaber crystal into a lightfoil, reduce the damage of that lightsaber crystal by 1.
Upgrade the difficulty of all Gunnery checks and checks triggered by the Guided quality made using missiles, rockets, or torpedoes targeting the starship once.
Upgrade the difficulty of Piloting checks for other ships within close range once.
[DE] on a Piloting check may be spent to inflict a Critical Hit on that pilot's ship.
In dual-saber mode, add Linked 1 and Unwieldy 2
In spin mode, also add Defensive 1 and Deflection 1
When used in a Saber Throw action, the spinning motion adds stability that adds [BO] to the check and increases the blade's damage by +1
A character with the Enhance Force power may also use an Inquisitorius lightsaber to fly
While the user openly displays the weapon, add automatic [SU][AD] to social skill checks that character makes against Mandalorian characters.
The integrated optics counts as a scope and reduces the difficulty of Ranged combat checks at long and extreme range once.
Upgrade the ability of combat checks made when using this weapon at short range once.
The weapon's environmental sealing prevents damage from water, sand, salt, caustic gases, and other dangerous environmental hazards.
The user may spend a maneuver to collapse the weapon for regular transport (reducing its encumbrance to 3) or expand the arrays to ready it for firing.
The repeating cannon can be fired in two different modes, standard and single-shot, switching between modes requires a maneuver.
If this weapon is ever destroyed it blows up and deals 10 damage to the wearer and other characters within engaged range.
The repeating cannon can be fired in two different modes, standard and single-shot, switching between modes requires a maneuver.
If this weapon is ever destroyed it blows up and deals 10 damage to the wearer and other characters within engaged range.
This weapon cannot be made to run out of ammo by spending [DE]
If a ranged attack with a vibrorang is unsuccessful, the user may spend [AD][AD] to have it safely return to his possession.
It can also be used in melee combat with the following profile: (Melee; Damage +2; Critical 2; Range [Engaged], Inaccurate 1, Pierce 2, Vicious 1).
If a ranged attack with a vibrorang is unsuccessful, the user may spend [AD][AD] to have it safely return to his possession.
It can also be used in ranged combat with the following profile: (Ranged (Light); Damage 4; Critical 2; Range [Medium], Limited Ammo 1, Pierce 2, Vicious 1).

After a character makes a successful combat check with an XX-23 tracer, he may make an Average [DI][DI] Astrogation check to determine the target's location anywhere in the galaxt until the tracer is removed.

After vehicle is hit by a termite torpedo, for remainder of encounter, whenever crew performs a check, attacker can spend [TH][TH] to have ship suffer 2 hull trauma or system strain, and can spend [DE] to inflict a Critical Hit. As an action, crew aboard attacked ship may perform a Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check to repress effect for 1 round.

After vehicle is hit by a termite torpedo, for remainder of encounter, whenever crew performs a check, attacker can spend [TH][TH] to have ship suffer 2 hull trauma or system strain, and can spend [DE] to inflict a Critical Hit. As an action, crew aboard attacked ship may perform a Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check to repress effect for 1 round.

Finding a CS14 on an individual requires a Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check. A character must make a Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Computers check to find the CS14 with a weapon scanner. The difficulty of the latter check can be reduced by one or two levels at the Game Master's discretion, depending on the type of scanner being used and the attentiveness of the operator.

Switching the Nightsinger to stealth mode requries a maneuver. This makes locating the shooter by tracing the blaster bolt or spotting a muzzle blast effectively impossible. It also grants the weapon the Slow Firing 2 quality for the remainder of the encounter.
A character who makes a successful Brawl attack when using a garrote against a target can cause that target to become suffocated.
Targets may attempt to break free of a garrote with an opposed Brawl vs. Brawl check, adding [SE] for each round they have been caught.
Spotting sap gloves on an individual requires a Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check.
After making a successful combat check with an Oura Blade, the wielder may spend [AD] to inflict an automatic hit on the target, doing the attack's base damage, and may do so multiple times.
May suffer up to Force Rating in strain, adding automatic [AD] for each to next combat check this turn.
When using a maneuver to aim, gain [BO][BO]. Cannot use second maneuver to aim again.
As a maneuver, may convert the bo-rifle to melee mode.
Does not add +1 difficulty with engaged opponent.
GM may spend [TH][TH] to damage panic pistol.
As a maneuver, wielder may suffer up to 5 strain. Next attack with arquebus gains Pierce quality with rating equal to strain suffered.

All targets suffering at least 1 wound, or are within medium range without environmental protection, must make a Formidable ([DI][DI][DI][DI][DI]) Resilience check. Target suffers 2 wound and 2 strain per [TH] and a +50 Critical Injury if check failed. [DE] means they must make check again at start of next turn.
When recovering strain at end of encounter, Vurk may heal one additional strain when holding a Semblan dagger.
May only be fired using the Autofire quality
GM may spend [DE] or [TH][TH][TH] to have the weapon overheat and jam. Clearing jam requires a maneuver.
Character may spend [AD][AD] on a missed attack to have it return to their hands at the beginning of their next turn.
If attacking a target of silhouette 2 or greater, an RPS-6 adds [BO] if the user performs an aim maneuver.

Name: A280-CFE Convertible Heavy Blaster Pistol (Pistol Mode)

BaseMods.MiscDesc: May spend a maneuver to convert to and from pistol and rifle mode.

Name: A280-CFE Convertible Heavy Blaster Pistol (Rifle Mode)

BaseMods.MiscDesc: May spend a maneuver to convert to and from pistol and rifle mode.
GM may spend [TH][TH] or [DE] to cause this weapon to run out of ammo.

Name: Vac Attack Mk-127 Concealable Disc Launcher (Single-Line Mode)

BaseMods.MiscDesc: May spend a maneuver to change to or from single-line mode and arc mode.
If two are worn on each wrist, may be fired as a single weapon with the Linked 1 quality.
Noticing an individual wearing one or a pair of these weapons requires a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Perception check.

Name: Vac Attack Mk-127 Concealable Disc Launcher (Arc Mode)

BaseMods.MiscDesc: May spend a maneuver to change to or from single-line mode and arc mode.
If two are worn on each wrist, may be fired as a single weapon with the Linked 1 quality.
Noticing an individual wearing one or a pair of these weapons requires a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Perception check.
Noticing an individual wearing one of these weapons requires a Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Perception check.
[TH][TH][TH] or [DE] may be used to cause the weapon to burn the wielder, causing 3 wound.
Setting up a redirection crystal requires a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Skulduggery check.
Hitting a redirection crystal requires a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Ranged Light orRanged Heavy check.
The redirection crystal is destroyed upon use.
Reduces difficulty of combat checks made at long or extreme range by 1. A DE-10 in need of minor repairs does not add [SE] to checks. Add [BO] to checks made to repair the weapon.
Remove [SE] due to darkness from any combat checks made with the weapon. When outside of an aquatic environment, has the Innacurate 2 item quality.

When the E5 suffers damage, it suffers 1 additional step of damage. During combat, GMs can spend [TH][TH][TH] or [DE] to force an E5 to overheat, damaging it by one step and dealing 2 wounds to the wielder if they are organic.
Fires blue or yellow blaster bolts depending on blaster gas source

Wearer upgrades the ability of Brawn checks made to grip, crush, or hold onto items once. A GM may spend [DE] or [TH][TH][TH] generated on any checks made to crush or destroy something with crushgaunts to deal 2 wounds to the wearer.

As an action, make an Average ([DI][DI]) Ranged (Light) check to secure the exoglove's grappling hook to an object within medium range. If successful, as a maneuver on their next turn, they may reel in the cord, pulling themselves to the object (Or, if the object is lighter and unsecured, the object to them).
Counts as a melee weapon for the purposes of the Parry talent.
During a successful attack against a target at engaged range, the SX-21 has the Pierce 4 item quality rather than the Blast 6 item quality
GM may spend [TH][TH][TH] to have it overheat and inoperable for three turns.
GM may spend [DE] to have it explode, dealing full damage to user and Blast damage to anything engaged with user.
May run out of ammo on a [TH][TH][TH], as well as a [DE].
Can only be used at medium range or higher.

Overcharged: Once per round as a maneuver, the wielder may set Han Solo's blaster to fire an overcharged shot. Upgrade the difficulty of the next attack with this weapon once to add the Pierce 7 item quality to that attack. If the attack generates [TH][TH] or [DE], the GM may cause the blaster to run out of ammo.
Implied Violence: Once per encounter when making a Coercion or Negotiation check, the wielder may, as an incidental, draw or gesture to the S-195 to upgrade the ability of the check once

Quarrel Bandolier: Once per encounter, the wielder may spend a maneuver to load a specialized quarrel and either add the Blast 6, Breach 1, Concussive 1, Disorient 2, Ion, or Vicious 4 quality to the next combat check made with Chewbacca's Bowcaster.

Dramatic Entrance: Darth Vader's red lightsaber is naturally intimidating. Once per encounter when making a Coercion check (or using an ability that requires a Coercion check to activate), the wielder may ignite this lightsaber to upgrade the ability of the check once.

Return of the Jedi: When the wielder uses Luke Skywalker's Lightsaber and the Reflect talent to decrease damage from a ranged attack, the wielder may spend a Destiny Point to allow all allies in the encounter to decrease the difficulty of any Discipline checks they make for the remainder of the encounter by 3, to a minimum of Simple (-).

Bastion of Safety: Kenobi's lightsaber draws the eye of every combatant on the field if ignited. Once per encounter before igniting, the wielder may make a Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Leadership or Negotiation check as an incidental to draw fire. If successful, until the wielder's next turn, whenever an enemy character in the current encounter makes a ranged combat check that could target the wielder, they must target the wielder. The GM may spend [TH][TH] or [DE] to exclude an enemy from this effect.
